n then it repeats some weird crap forever

BusyBox v1.1.3 (Debian 1:1.1.3-5ubuntu12) Built-in shell (Ash)
2008-06-12T09:55:00.000Z	murgi_chor		Enter 'help' for a list of commands
2008-06-12T09:55:00.000Z	murgi_chor		(initramfs)
no matter what you choose do you go into the busybox
did you choose the check_ram option yet
that fixed it for me i let that run like 3 times in a row because i didn't know what it was doing
do the memory check with live cd and then when its done ( i let mine run 3 times because i didn'tknow what it was doing , lol)  chose the install option
check ram is one of the options originally like install
i am sure of it, when you pop the disc in, there are about 6 items in the list after you choose your language
